data.title: My Wife Had An Interesting Conversation with Kurt Vonnegut: But They are Both Dead

data.text:
Dead authors can’t see, but they inspire others to write about what they think.

It’s a nice twist to life beyond the shelves of a bookstore.

I figured out that once an author dies, they don’t care what we mortals do. Dead writers hit their peak, aged gracefully, made their mark on society, and moved on. Some ended their own lives like Hemingway; others died naturally. Many are still with us and continue to enlighten the world with their words.

I feel the dead ones are hanging out in The Blue Bar of Heaven in ultimate retirement. They’ve relinquished their stories and philosophies to the interpretations of the living. And in many cases, our interpretations are wrong but always open for debate.

Remarkably, dead authors live on because books never die. And words on the internet live in perpetuity. Characters are immortal, and thoughts are made of concrete; historical facts can’t be changed. All genres have their threads of everlasting symbolism, fantasy, and futuristic existence.
